authors.description:
My pictures, my videos, my life in Japan.

So here's the thing. I'm a Canadian girl who is nearly fluent in Japanese, currently working as the Japanese TA at my university. This blog is entirely personal. It's my pictures, my advice, and my stories. That being said, I did want to enjoy Tumblr as it was supposed to be enjoyed with the reblogging and what not and so I made a separate account. If you're interested in this blog because it's specific to Japan, that's awesome. If you're curious about what I'm interested in (aside from Japan) check out http://jesshi-nee.tumblr.com/ .

ARE YOU FROM SPACE?!"

authors.description:
え？フォーサイド？なに寝ぼけてるんだ？
　　　　　　ここはムーンサイドだぜ。　
　　　　　　Fourside? Are you still sleeping?
　　　　　　This is Moonside.

　　　　　　「はい」が「いいえ」で「いいえ」が「はい」。
　　　　　　ここ、ムーンサイドじゃそれが常識。
　　　　　　"Yes" is "No" and "No" is "Yes".
　　　　　　It makes perfect sense in Moonside.

――Informations――
　
2014/1/10
「A.C.T.ism」および「アクトイズム」を 商標登録致しました。

特許庁に出願した「A.C.T.ism」および「アクトイズム」について、2014年1月10日付けで商標権を取得しました。
この商標権は2024年1月10日まで存続致します。
　
商標 　「　A.C.T.ism　」
　　　　登録第5641991号

商標 　「　アクトイズム　」
　　　　登録第5641990号



2013/12/20
フォトマスター ／ 写真とカメラの実用知識検定試験 の 『 準 1 級 』 を取得しました。
認定番号 ： 第12800906-11D号


写真イベント『御苗場(ONAEBA)』
に出展しました。
　 「御苗場vol.11 関西」

A.C.T.ism


Thank you for the visit！
I am an artist in Osaka, JAPAN.
I'm sorry if I write wrong English.

"A.C.T.ism" is consists of three meaning.　

Art. ／Create. ／TrueHeart.

I want to perform photography based on my ISM.

Please enjoy my photograph.

authors.description:
I've recently started learning Japanese and figured I'd keep a blog where I can post random sentences I think of, as a way of practicing.

I am not good at Japanese yet, and this blog is meant to be a personal archive. So don't try learning by what I write here!

If you're a native speaker or knows Japanese well, please feel free to let me know if you find any mistakes in what I write - just leave a message.

authors.title: 変遷を観る
authors.name: bouzz0021hensen

authors.description:
Everyday, a little bit of Japanese ^__^

A guide for every picture:

Every picture is divided into 5 parts
-the number of the post in Japanese
-the kanji
-the furigana
-the romanization (Japanese pronunciation)
-the english translation 

Under each picture are some comments about the word.

If I make mistakes (which I'm sure there will happen), forgive me. ^^' I've been studying Japanese at uni for almost a year now. If the error I made is so obvious, I shall be forced to punish myself (I will be happy to do so). (or not...)

authors.description:
Learning a second language is fun and challenging.  But you can only get so much out of a textbook.

I will be posting Japanese words (along with pronunciation and explanation) that I learned through talking to host club workers and reading visual kei blogs, lyrics, and twitters.

Obscure, funny, and dirty words that you probably won't find in your textbook.  Enjoy!

(Note: I tag explicit sexual words as "Dirty Words" in case you want to filter those out)

authors.title: A LIVED
authors.name: being-time

authors.description:
Hello, my name is Christi. In 2011, I moved to Tokyo, Japan. As you may already know, Japan is quite a unique place. It's one of the few places in the world where the ultra modern is juxtaposed against the ancient, where you can behold the overwhelming sensory overload at Shibuya crossing, where you can enjoy the serene quiet of a traditional garden, where you can pick fresh sushi off of a conveyor belt while drinking hot tea, all in the same day. Experience it here, with me. :)

Follow me on Twitter!
